text.section: There is a Health and Human Services Referral Board in the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene.

section.section: The term of a member is 4 years.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
If a vacancy occurs after a term has begun, a successor shall be appointed to represent the organization or group in which the vacancy occurs.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member may not serve more than two consecutive full terms.

text.section: The Board shall determine the time and place of the meetings and may adopt rules for the conduct of the meetings.
A majority of the Board members constitutes a quorum for transacting business at any meeting and action by a majority of Board members present at the meeting shall be an act of the Board.

Each year, the Board shall elect from among the members:
A chair and vice chair; and
Any other officer the Board requires.

Each member of the Board:
Serves without compensation; but
Is entitled to reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.
The Maryland State Association of United Ways shall provide staff to the Board.
The composition of the Board as to the race and gender of its members shall reflect the composition of the population of the State.
